Dr: Denis Mukwege's official statement: Dr. Mukwege released a statement on the website for the Panzi Foundation, confirming that he resigned from his duties as Vice-President of the Multi-sectoral Coronavirus Response Committee and President of the Health Commission. He cited reasons such as slow testing, problems implementing a response strategy, and inadequate preventative measures.
The quote is fabricated: The expert's verdict clearly states that the quote claiming Dr. Mukwege resigned because he was ordered to fabricate COVID-19 case and death numbers is fake. This aspect highlights the lack of authenticity in the claim.
Facebook flagging the post: The post containing the false claim was flagged by Facebook as part of their efforts to combat false news and misinformation on their platform. This indicates that the claim did not meet the platform's standards of accuracy.
Confirmation from Panzi Foundation spoke: A spokesperson from the Panzi Foundation, the charitable organization founded by Dr. Mukwege, confirmed to PolitiFact that the claim was false. This confirmation adds credibility to the expert's verdict and further verifies the inauthenticity of the claim.
